etymologies: early 17th century: from modern Latin belemnites, based on Greek belemnon ‘dart’

definitions: an extinct cephalopod mollusk with a bullet-shaped internal shell that is typically found as a fossil in marine deposits of the Jurassic and Cretaceous periods.

notes.text: Order Belemnoidea, class Cephalopoda: many genera

shortDefinitions: extinct cephalopod mollusc with bullet-shaped internal shell
